"What's the difference between a struct and class"

"in a struct all vars are default public
 B: only structs are utilized to produce instances of a class
 C: No difference
 D: None of the above"
"Which of these is known as the 'garbage collector'"

"A: constructor
 B: destructor
 C: copy move constructor 
 D: None of the above"
"Where is dynamically allocated placed? "

"A: The stack
 B:data 
 C: the heap 
 D: None of the above"
" What Is A Default Constructor?"

"A: doesn't exist
 B: a constructor that isn't used
 C: a constructor that takes no parameters 
 D: None of the above"
Python is a ....

A: High-level language
B: Low-level language

B: malloc
C: true

This is C# test Easy 1.
A: this is good\nB: what\'s for dinner.
" Which of the following operator creates a pointer to a variable in C#?"

"A: sizeof
 B: typeof
 C: *
 D: ampersand"
Which of the following is correct about variable naming conventions in C#?

"A: A name must begin with a letter that could be followed by a sequence of letters, digits (0 to 9) or underscore
 B: The first character in an identifier cannot be a digit
 C: Both of the above
 D: None of the above"
"Which of the following can be used to define the member of a class externally?"

"A) :
 B) ::
 C) #
 D) none of the mentioned"
"Which of the following operator can be used to access the member function of a class?"
"Which of the following gives the correct count of the constructors that a class can define?"

"A) 1
 B) 2
 C) Any number
 D) None of the above"

"What is the correct name of a method which has the same name as that of class and used to destroy objects? Note â€“ This method gets called automatically when the application is at the final stage waiting for the process to terminate. "

"A) Constructor
 B) Finalize()
 C) Destructor
 D) End"
" Which of the following access specifier in C# allows a class to expose its member variables and member functions to other functions and objects in the current assembly??"

"A: Public
 B: Private
 C: Protected
 D: Internal"
"Which of the following converts a type to a small floating point number in C#?

"A: ToInt64
 B: ToSbyte
 C: ToSingle
 D: None of the above"
"Which of the following statements is not correct for run-time polymorphism?"

"A) The overridden base method should be virtual, abstract or override.
 B) An abstract method is implicitly a virtual method.
 C) An abstract inherited property cannot be overridden in a derived class.
 D) Both the override method and virtual method must have the same access level modifier."
"Which of the following keywords is used to refer base class constructor to subclass constructor?"

"A) this
 B) static
 C) base
 D) extend"
"Which of the following options represents the type of class which does not have its own objects but acts as a base class for its subclass?"

"A) Static class
 B) Sealed class
 C) Abstract class
 D) Derived class"
"Which of the following represents a class that inherits an abstract class but it does not define all of its functions?"

"A) Abstract
 B) A simple class
 C) Static class
 D) derived class"
"Which of the following property of Array class in C# gets a 32-bit integer, the total number of elements in all the dimensions of the Array?"

"A: Rank
 B: LongLength
 C: Length
 D: None of the above"
"Which of the following is the default access specifier of a class member function?? "

"A: Public
 B: Private
 C: Protected
 D: Internal"
". Which of the following represents the process of defining two or more methods within the same class having the same name but different parameters list?"

"A) Method overloading
 B) Method overriding
 C) Encapsulation
 D) None of the mentioned"
"Which of the following are applicable for overloading?"

"A) Constructors
 B) Methods
 C) Both A and B
 D) None of the mentioned"
"Which of the following keywords can be used to overload user-defined types by defining static member functions?"

"A) op
 B) opoverload
 C) operator
 D) operatoroverload"
"Which of the following modifier applies when a virtual method is redefined by a derived class?"

"A) overloads
 B) override
 C) overridable
 D) virtual"
"Which of the following is true about exceptions in C#?"

"A:The exception classes in C# are mainly directly or indirectly derived from the System.Exception class
 B: C# exceptions are represented by classes
 C: Both of the above.
 D: None of the above"
"Does C# support multiple inheritance"

"A: Yes
 B: No
 C: Sometimes
 D:When it feels like it"
"Which of the following keywords can be used to access a member of the base class from derived class?"

"A) upper
 B) base
 C) this
 D) None of the above"
"Which of the following represents the process where a method in a subclass has same name and type signature as a method in its superclass?"

"A) Method overloading
 B) Method overriding
 C) Method hiding
 D) None of the mentioned"
"Which of the following modifiers can be used to prevent Method overriding?"

"A) Static
 B) Constant
 C) Sealed
 D) final"
"Which of the following Access specifiers can be used for an interface?"

"A) Public
 B) Protected
 C) Private
 D) All of the above"
"Which of these is not a way to declare variables in JavaScript?"

"A: let
 B: const
 C: int
 D: var"
"What's a primary use of JavaScript?

"A: Styling the Page
 B: Serving as a Database
 C: Scripting
 D: Making the Page Interactive"
"How do you dynamically create an element in JavaScript?"

"A: document.createElement('div')
 B: document.renderElement('div')
 C: document.makeElement('div')
 D: None of the above"
"How do I access the value of a key in an object?"

"A: myVal = Obj.key
 B: myVal = Obj.val
 C: Object.keys(Obj).val 
 D: None of the above"
"What's another name for JavaScript?

"A: TypeScript
 B: React
 C: ECMAScript
 D: None of the above"
"what does document.querySelectorAll() do?"

"A: grabs all elements with that class name
 B: grabs all elements with that id name
 C: breaks your system 
 D: None of the above"
"How many variable keywords use variable hoisting?"
"What does .split('') do in JavaScript? "

"A: Makes each character in a string an element in an array
 B: removes all spaces from a string
 C: removes all spaces from the end of a string
 D: makes each element in an array part of the same string"
"what is the purpose of an arrow function in JS?"

"A: helps optimize your code
 B:cleaner, easy to write functions 
 C: it's the only way to write funcitons 
 D: None of the above"
"What is an advantage of the React JavaScript framework?"

"A:Better styling options
 B: fast transitions/page loading
 C: no need for vanilla JavaScript
 D: None of the above"
"How do you convert a nodelist into an array in JavaScript?"

"A: myArr = Array.this(nodelist)
 B: myArr = Array.to(nodelist)
 C: myArr = Array.from(nodelist)
 D:myArr = Array.convert(nodelist)"
"which of these is not a data type in JavaScript?"

"A: Number
 B: Boolean
 C: String 
 D: None of the above"
JS easy 1
A: this is good\nB: what\'s for dinner.
